channel.title: Geometry Help
channel.description: I need tips or guides you can help me with geometry. Also Any tips to remember stuff because I know when my teacher teaches then sometimes forget the step and during a test my head goes jibber jabber

item.title: Geometry Help
item.dc:creator: @ZIAN678 ZIAN678
item.description:
@ZIAN678 wrote:

well for me u hafta ignore everything tht is going around the room and just focus on the teacher. it doesnt matter if he/she is the worst person/ugliest or w\e. tht person i s there 4 a reason.

i know this 4 a fact bc my gf is in the same class as me and i dnt pay attention to her. I do wut i’m suppose to do. 2nd yr in Hs and i have A+ in geo. they wanna move me up to jr classes =\

Read full topic

item.title: Geometry Help
item.dc:creator: @citisin citisin
item.description:
@citisin wrote:

Basic Theorems to Know (connaissez bien!):
Pythagorean Theorem: a(a)+b(b)=c© or in other terms c = sq(a + b)*
Trigonometry Operators: sin(x)=opposite side/hypotenuse (longest side of a triangle), cos(x)=adjacent side/hypotenuse, tan(x)=opposite side/adjacent side
Basic Rules of Right Triangles: for pattern triangles 3,4,5;5,12,13;7,24,25 triangles (sets separated by semicolons ‘;’) side angles can easily be derived from the side length (n.b. the side lengths maybe products of the numbers within the set, but will always have the numbers within the set as multiples). the length of the hypotenuse of a right triangle with integral sides, or in other words, the largest number in a Pythagorean triple. The length of the longer leg of this triangle is equal to the sum of the three sides of the preceding triangle in this series of triangles, and the shorter leg is equal to the difference between the preceding bypassed Fibonacci number and the shorter leg of the preceding triangle. Special triangles like 30-60-90 and 45-45-90 have side lengths in proportion to the shortest leg (e.g. for a 30-60-90 triangle the ratio of sides is L, SqR3( L ), and 2 L; L representing the shortest leg, 2 L representing the hypotenuse.

That is probably enough to digest right now, I suggest you ask your teacher for a more in depth description of Pythagorean triples and a list of important postulates and proofs that will be of pinnical importance throughout the year.

Read full topic
